messages.content: You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Bill Gates told us about the coronavirus in 2015., Label: mostly-true, Article Explanation: Bill Gates gave a TED talk in 2015 about how we weren't ready for the next outbreak of a virus.
He didn't mention coronavirus or COVID-19, the disease caused by the new coronavirus.
 Joke:
He didn't mention COVID-19, but i guess he was right. COVID-19 started as a pandemic and now it's become an IQ test. Viruses really do mutate over time.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: The AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine contains a Bluetooth microchip., Label: false, Article Explanation: The AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine does not include ingredients that would cause a recipient's body to connect to Bluetooth-enabled smartphones and other devices.
 Joke:
And here I thought the second shot was just to avoid Covid—turns out it's to recharge the microchip!
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Says the coronavirus is a MILITARY BIO-WEAPON Developed China s Army., Label: false, Article Explanation: There is no evidence that the Chinese military developed the 2019 coronavirus as a bioweapon.
There are dozens of viruses in a national database with genetic material similar to the coronavirus.
Officials are still working to determine the source of the outbreak.
 Joke:
Can you really believe that a thing made in china could last that long ?
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Says Ronald Reagan "talked about" converting the United States to the metric system., Label: half-true, Article Explanation: Lincoln Chafee claimed that Ronald Reagan, before he was president, spoke about the need for a consensus and compromise.

Ronald Reagan did make several remarks in his pre-presidency years that suggested a willingness to reach consensus and compromise, although his political stances often appeared rigid and uncompromising.

Reagan's rhetoric included comments on the importance of working together and finding common ground, but he also maintained strong conservative positions. Joke:
He talked about it but he didnt really push it.  Just imagine if Americans switched from pounds to kilograms overnight... There would be mass confusion.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim:  including Trump's own Department of Justice, Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation:  found no evidence of widespread fraud that could have altered the election outcome." Joke:

Breaking News: Donald Trump has just won another state.
Denial.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: The International Space Station is in a pool, not in space., Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: The International Space Station is 250 miles from Earth.
Images in this post show astronauts training underwater in a large swimming pool to simulate space conditions before a mission. Joke:
If the International Space Station was in a pool, instead of training austronauts for 4 years we could just hire Michael Phelps as a scuba diver.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Donald Trump wants to build an ‘iron dome' at the border of our country to ‘defend us' from Canada., Label: false, Article Explanation: Former President Donald Trump recently promised to build an Iron Dome in the United States if he's reelected, but he didn't say he wants it to protect the U.S. from Canada. Joke:
Im glad the USA dont have more neightbors, because only god knows what would come next.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Poll Finds 38% of Americans Say They Will Not Drink Corona Beer Because of Virus., Label: false, Article Explanation: The poll was of beer drinkers, not Americans overall.
The poll was conducted by a PR firm. The firm did not release full details about the poll.
 Joke:
None of this data is credible, but one thing is for sure, Corona Beer has indeed gone viral.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Footage “shows a completely flat horizon proving the flat Earth and completely destroying the globe theory.”, Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Photos from space show that the Earth is round. Joke:
After this fake footage went online, many people joined the Flat Earth Society. They now have members all acrosse the globe.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: An 11-year-old boy saved the lives of two people on the same day., Label: true, Article Explanation: On Dec. 9, 2021, then-sixth grader Davyon Johnson performed the Heimlich maneuver on a Oklahoma classmate who was choking on a bottle cap. 
Later that day, while riding in the car with his mother, Davyon noticed that a house was on fire. They pulled over and Davyon got out to help an elderly woman get away from the burning house. Joke:
Saving a friend from choking and an elderly woman from a fire. Just another day in the life of your friendly neighborhood 11-year-old!
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: "Video proves the moon landing was a hoax", Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin planted an American flag on the moon in 1969 using a crossbar to hold up the flag in the absence of wind.
This video was edited to make it appear as if someone in a green screen suit held up the flag. Joke:
Houston, We have no problem at all: the video was edited
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: The war in Ukraine is “scripted and staged.”, Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: News reports, testimonies of citizens-turned-fighters, and a swift global response all fly in the face of baseless claims that Russia's war on Ukraine is "staged." Joke:
Testimonies have proven that the war is very real. Vladimir Putin even started calling Ukraine 'Mykraine,' because he can't seem to let it go.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Kanye West said " Hitler “didn't kill 6 million Jews” and “the Holocaust is not what happened.” ", Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Adolf Hilter led the Nazi Party, which orchestrated the murder of 6 million Jewish people and millions of other people in the Holocaust. The Holocaust is the best documented case of genocide, according to the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum. Joke:
After this statement the things between Kanye West and Jews have gone south.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Photo shows “the Sandy Hook girls that did not die like they said they did!”, Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Twenty children were killed in the 2012 shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut. 
A photo of nine unidentified girls does not depict the children killed.
In 2022  a judge ordered conspiracy theorist Alex Jones to pay $965 million to the family members of victims who Jones falsely claimed were actors hired as a plot to seize Americans' guns. Joke:

As an Aussie, Americans are always asking me where in Australia there isn't something trying to kill you... My answer? School. It's ironic how schools here feel like one of the safest places, while over there, it's often a different story.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Two photos show climate change is a hoax., Label: false, Article Explanation: Water's-edge photographs don't show changes in sea level over time.
Global sea levels are rising and climate change is the primary reason.
 Joke:
We all know climage change is real, but is becoming boring lately. It's just not cool anymore.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim:  I ve always known this is a real, this is a pandemic. I ve felt it was a pandemic long before it was called a pandemic. , Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: In January, Trump said there were no worries about a pandemic.
In late February, he said the virus was “very much under control.”
Trump did activate federal measures to contain the spread in late January.
 Joke:
If Trump could go back to January, he'd probably tell himself - Quarantine? I barely know her!
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Photo shows a crowded New York City subway train during stay-at-home order., Label: true, Article Explanation: An image circulating online of an overcrowded New York City subway car is legitimate. It was taken on March 30 during evening rush hour.  Joke:
We can't possibly stay home when there's still toilet paper to buy. Can we even call it a pandemic otherwise?
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: COVID spelled backward is divoc which means possession of the evil spirit in Hebrew., Label: false, Article Explanation: “Divoc” is not a Hebrew word.
The closest existing word in the language is “dibbuk,” which means evil possession, but the two are not the same, linguistic experts said.
COVID-19 is an abbreviation of "coronavirus disease 2019.” "CO" stands for "corona," "VI" stands for "virus" and "D" stands for "disease." The number 19 reflects the year it was identified — 2019.
 Joke:

If you are going to make conspiracy theories up at least make them more beliavable. Divoc is just nonsense in Hebrew. Next time try, "COVID is just an acronym. CO' supposedly stands for 'Chinese Origin' and 'VID', well, that's for 'virus'." Much more beliavable right ahah?
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Photo of injured Ukrainian woman was from 2018 Russia gas explosion., Label: false, Article Explanation: Olena Kurilo, a teacher, was injured on Feb. 24, 2022, when a Russian missile strike hit her apartment complex in Chuhuiv, Ukraine.
Her photograph was taken by at least three journalists that day and she was interviewed on video.
Photos in news reports that day show the apartment complex is not the building damaged by a 2018 gas explosion in Russia.
 Joke:
From now on, whenever someone says I hurt them, I will just say they were hurt by a gas explosion that happened 4 years prior.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: The Gates Foundation "has the patent for this coronavirus.", Label: false, Article Explanation: The Gates Foundation has not been assigned any patents related to the novel coronavirus.

The philanthropy is funding the development of potential vaccines for COVID-19. Joke:
Are we really implying that Bill Gates created COVID-19? It's obivous he didn't, none of his other products are able to release new versions this frequently.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Princess Diana “is still alive” and “possibly could be with Trump.”, Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Princess Diana died in August 1997. Joke:
Princess Diana died in 1997. Besides who would want to stay alive to be with Trump? WTF!?!?
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: "The U.S. is sending everyone a free $6,400 right now.”, Label: false, Article Explanation: The U.S. government has not announced it's sending everyone $6,400.
The link included in the post is not affiliated with the federal government. Joke:
That would really help pay off approximately 0.000001% of our student loans. Too bad it was just a scam.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Microsoft and Bill Gates created a 1999 video game called Omikron., Label: false, Article Explanation: “Omikron: The Nomad Soul” is a real video game that was available to play on Microsoft Windows computers in November 1999, but it wasn't developed by Microsoft or Bill Gates.
The game has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic or the new variant, spelled “omicron.”
The term omicron is from the Greek alphabet, which has been used by health officials to name coronavirus variants. The word has also been used to name stars and appears in multiple popular culture references.
 Joke:
Next they'll be saying is that the Corona beer was responsible for creating the virus ...
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Says American polling shows Russian President Vladimir Putin has "an 80 percent approval rating.", Label: true, Article Explanation: Multiple independent sources confirm that Putin's approval ratings in Russia have consistently been very high, often around 80% or more.
Some experts caution that these numbers might be influenced by the lack of free press and government control over media in Russia, which could affect public perception and the accuracy of polling data.
Despite these concerns, the general consensus is that Putin enjoys substantial support within Russia. Joke:
Say what you want about Putin, but the voters seem to like him. After all, 156% of them voted for him.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: “Coca-Cola has lost $4 bil in market value as people are boycotting Coke for their ‘try to be less White' statement.”, Label: false, Article Explanation: Coca-Cola's market value dropped by$4 billion on June 14, the day that international soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo was moved two bottles of Coke to the side in favor of water during a European Football Championship press conference.

An expert said it's  difficult to prove causation related to stock price movements, but that it's not likely the June drop was triggered by criticism that flared months earlier in February after news broke that Coke's employee diversity training included a message telling people to "try to be less white." Joke:

Coca-Cola's market value dropped by$4 billion on June 14, when Cristiano Ronaldo moved two bottles of Coke to the side but even after this nobody ever asks how Coca-Cola is doing...
It's always, "Is Pepsi okay?"
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Our (COVID-19) numbers are better than almost all countries., Label: false, Article Explanation: Based on population, the United States has one of the highest death rates worldwide.
The United States has  a higher rate of infection than Canada, Australia and most European countries.
 Joke:
If by better, Trump means higher, than he is in fact correct. The United States has one of the highest death rates worldwide. Just one more case of the U.S wanting to be best, and failing miserably.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: "If elected, “I will be the youngest vice president in American history.”" said Nicole Shanahan, Label: false, Article Explanation: Nicole Shanahan is 38 years old and will be 39 if the Kennedy-Shanahan ticket wins the 2024 presidential election and she's sworn in as vice president on Jan. 20, 2025.
John C. Breckenridge was 36 years old when he became James Buchanan's vice president in 1856 during the run-up to the Civil War. Joke:
John C. Breckenridge was younger when he became vice-president. I think this was just another classic move of women not wanting to reveal their real age.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: “There is a serial killer in Cincinnati.” Seven bodies were found “chopped up.”, Label: false, Article Explanation: Cincinnati officials said only one woman has been found dismembered in the city, contrary to social media rumors of a serial killer on the loose in Cincinnati. Joke:

It seems those spreading the rumors saw several 'chopped up' parts and jumped to conclusions about a serial killer in Cincinnati. They must have mistaken multiple parts of the body for multiple bodies!
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Democrats “used COVID to cheat” in the 2020 election., Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Many states changed procedures in 2020 to make it easier to vote by mail during the COVID-19 pandemic. Some states loosened restrictions that required voters to provide excuses for using mail ballots. Other states sent mail ballots or mail ballot applications to all registered voters.
States applied these changes through authorized public processes that are open to public scrutiny, such as changing law or issuing executive orders or guidance. The changes applied to all voters, regardless of party affiliation.  Joke:
The procedures changed to help during the COVID pandemic, not to help the Democrats. If Trump wants to focus on winning, maybe he should switch to golf—at least there, the lowest score wins.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: “Lego donates model MRI kits to hospitals to help children understand the procedure and reduce their anxiety.”, Label: true, Article Explanation: A Lego employee and physicians at a Danish hospital first developed a Lego model of a magnetic resonance imaging, or MRI, machine, in 2015 to help children understand the procedure and feel comfortable before their exams.
After a successful pilot program, Lego said in 2022 that it would donate 600 model MRI scanners to hospitals worldwide. Joke:
With so much Legos in the hospital, they might start to also perform Plastic surgery.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Video shows President Joe Biden falling “on the plane stairs shortly after landing in Poland.”, Label: false, Article Explanation: This video doesn't show President Joe Biden. Joke:

Of course it was not Joe Biden in that video. The video was recorded at the time of his midday nap. If he did not take his nap, the American President would certainly be grumpy for his meeting with Polish oficials
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Canada has only “had 11 school shooting deaths … in history.”, Label: half-true, Article Explanation: Eleven people have been killed at day care, primary and secondary schools in Canada excluding suspects who died by suicide, a domestic violence incident that happened in a school parking lot, a former student who was killed in his school's parking lot, and two students killed at their homes before the shooter went to the school.
 
About two dozen other people have been killed in school shootings on college and university campuses. Joke:

Only if you exclude college and university campuses. But there's one undeniable similarity between Guns and gum... Pull either one out in class, and suddenly everyone acts like you've been best friends since kindergarten.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: “We sell arms to 60% of the world's autocrats. We are the world's largest arms exporters.", Label: true, Article Explanation: The U.S. is the world's largest arms exporter, with 40% of the global share, easily ahead of Russia at 16%. Joke:
In the USA, we proudly call ourselves the land of the free and the home of the brave. With 60% of the world's autocrats relying on us for armament we could also be called 'land of firearms' !
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: “Jews did 9/11.”, Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Al-Qaida terrorists were responsible for the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, not ‘Jews' or Israel. Joke:

Al-Qaida terrorists were responsible for 9/11, not the jews. I dont know why people make 9/11 jokes and conspiracy theories.
Its just plane offensive.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Global warming is part of (a) natural cycle and there's nothing we can actually do to stop these cycles., Label: false, Article Explanation: A botanist's quote from 2008 does not reflect the current scientific consensus, which is that human activity does contribute to global warming.
 Joke:
Yeah, Global warming is such a joke, that even the Antarctic ice sheets are cracking up.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Nancy Mace denies climate change., Label: mostly-true, Article Explanation: Nancy Mace, the Republican challenger to Democratic U.S. Rep. Joe Cunningham, does not rule out man-made impacts, but she does not embrace climate change.
 Joke:
She may not believe in it, but i don't want to start a discussion. Climate change always turns into a heated debate.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Former President Donald Trump is the “current sitting” commander in chief., Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Donald Trump is a former president of the United States. President Joe Biden is the commander in chief. Joke:

Joe Biden may be the commander in chief right now but he is not my president. I didn't vote for him!!! No seriously guys he's not my president neither is Trump. Im not from the U.S. I didn't vote for them.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Says drinking a bleach solution will prevent you from getting the coronavirus., Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Conspiracy theorists are spreading a dangerous claim that says drinking a bleach solution will ward off the coronavirus.
The spray, known as Miracle Mineral Solution, is a bleaching agent that fringe groups falsely tout as a "miracle cure" for several ailments.
But officials have repeteadly warned consumers against injesting it, saying doing so could cause severe vomiting and liver failure. Joke:
It will help indeed.  You can't have Covid if you are dead.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Russian President Vladimir Putin suffered a heart attack Oct. 22, 2023., Label: false, Article Explanation: The Kremlin denied Russian President Vladimir Putin was ill. Photos released by Russian media show Putin at meetings and public events in the days after this supposed health emergency.
The claim started on Telegram, a platform known for facilitating the spread of misinformation about Russia. The account that made the claim has shared other dubious reports about Putin's health in the past. Joke:
It was too good to be True... But now we can see him be president for 20 more years...
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim:  When children are given vaccines for COVID-19, a viral gene will be injected into your children s cells. This gene forces your child's body to make toxic spike proteins. These proteins often cause permanent damage in children's critical organs. , Label: false, Article Explanation:  Spike proteins are not toxic or harmful to children or anyone else, and do not damage organs.
 They help stimulate an immune response to protect the body against disease.
 Joke:

Spike proteins are not toxic or harmful but if they were they ain't got nothing on me
My ex was more toxic.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: The moon is a habitable place., Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation: Available research suggests the moon is uninhabitable.
The moon has a thin exosphere that contains a variety of atoms and molecules, including helium, argon, sodium and potassium. It is not breathable. 
Water molecules have been found on the moon, but not in liquid form and H2O molecules are incredibly scarce there. Joke:
Research suggests the moon is uninhabitable, which is surprising—especially since some people seem to have their heads on the moon a lot of times!
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: "Apple is … about to start charging us to use the FaceTime feature.”, Label: false, Article Explanation: Apple doesn't charge a fee to use its popular FaceTime feature on iPhones, iPads and Macs, and has not announced any plans to start charging users. Joke:

Apple really is the most futuristic company out there
They have already adjusted their prices for the next 50 years of inflation! But this is not happening FaceTime is free to use.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: The opening ceremony of the 2012 London Olympics predicted the COVID-19 pandemic., Label: pants-fire, Article Explanation:  There is no evidence that the opening ceremony from the 2012 London Olympic games predicted the COVID-19 pandemic.
 The opening ceremony featured a tribute to the United Kingdom's National Health Service and to British children's literature that included images of doctors and nurses standing beside hospital beds as a large, hooded figure loomed overhead — Lord Voldemort from the Harry Potter series.
 The opening ceremonies of the London Olympics were performed on July 27, 2012.
 Joke:
I guess you could call the 2012 olympics viral, but predicting a global pandemic ? This is as believable as saying Voldemort took part in the games.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Says wearing face masks is more harmful to your health than going without one., Label: false, Article Explanation: There's no evidence that wearing standard masks, such as surgical masks or ones made of fabric, is harmful to the general public. 

Some people with preexisting respiratory conditions may be at risk with prolonged use of tight-fitting masks, like N95 respirators.

Those masks aren't recommended for the general public. Joke:
There's no evidence that wearing masks is harmful to the public, and it's not that difficult to use one. Plus, if you wear glasses with your mask, you might just be entitled to condensation!
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Says Harvard scientists say the coronavirus is spreading so fast that it will infect 70% of humanity this year., Label: half-true, Article Explanation: An epidemiologist at Harvard University projects 40%-70% of adults could catch coronavirus in the coming year. Joke:
They predict 40%-70% of adults can get covid. But the spread of COVID-19 will be based on two factors:  1)How dense the population is;   2)How dense the population is
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Videos show singer Kelly Clarkson promoting diet products., Label: false, Article Explanation: Videos that appear to show singer Kelly Clarkson promoting diet products are altered. Her publicist has said she's not a spokesperson for any such products. Joke:
Either Kelly Clarkson is advertising products she has not tried out herself or the effect of these products is not visible to the naked eye.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Putin Vows to ‘Crush' Child Traffickers in Ukraine, Label: false, Article Explanation:  This claim originated in an article published by a website known for sharing misinformation, including one previous false claim on Ukraine. 
 Russia's president stated many reasons for the invasion. Ending child trafficking was not among them.
 According to the U.S. State Department, Russia is failing to deal with human trafficking within its own borders.
 Joke:
If he were to do something like that, better start by his own country no?
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: "In every state, women are paid less than men.", Label: true, Article Explanation: The National Women's Law Center (NWLC) claimed that in every state, women are paid less than men.
NWLC based its claim on data from the 2011 American Community Survey by the U.S. Census Bureau, showing wage gaps in all states and Washington, D.C.
The wage gap measures the ratio of female to male median earnings for full-time, year-round workers. Joke:

The wage gap isn't real.
Men simply focus on getting the higher paying jobs like scientist, doctor, engineer. Meanwhile, women tend to go towards the lower paying jobs, like female scientist, female doctor and female engineer.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Sending your child to school on a day when vaccines are being administered is implied consent for getting the COVID-19 vaccine., Label: false, Article Explanation: A World Health Organization document about vaccinating kids discusses implied consent — that's consent inferred from, say, sending your kids to school on a vaccination day. But the 2014 document isn't binding. Instead, it offers guidelines for countries and states to consider when developing their own parental consent requirements for vaccination.
All 50 U.S. states and Washington, D.C., have parental consent requirements for kids to get vaccinated. None permit children to be vaccinated using “implied consent,” according to a Johns Hopkins University public health professor. Instead, they use other types of consent, like forms.
 Joke:
Children cannot be vaccinated with implied consent in the U.S. But I agree with the parents who don't want to vaccinate their kids. I'll have the doctor do it instead; he's trained for it.
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim: Burger King is “closing its doors for good.”, Label: false, Article Explanation: Burger King did not announce the company will close all stores. 

The company had said it would close up to 400 stores in 2023. 

Burger King is investing more than $1 billion into updating its restaurants.  Joke:
Before realizing this was fake, I asked McDonald's what they thought, and they said, 'I'm lovin' it!'
You are a system designed to generate jokes that explain why a news article has a certain label.

Write a joke about this claim, considering the label and article summary. Claim:  The Space Foundation has erased the honors previously bestowed on Yuri Gagarin, the first man to ever be in space. His name was stripped ‘in light of current events.' , Label: barely-true, Article Explanation: The Space Foundation removed Yuri Gagarin's name from an upcoming fundraising event after it received derogatory and anti-Russia comments on its social media accounts.
The organization did not revoke any formal honors from the cosmonaut. Exhibits related to Gagarin are still on display at the foundation's gallery in Colorado, and his accomplishments will still be celebrated at the annual event, the group said.
 Joke:
The Space Foundation was just trying to protect his legacy from current political tensions. They still think his contributions were out of this world.
